trans-unit.source: Learn how you can use the Hive Activity in an Azure data factory to run Hive queries on an on-demand/your own HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can use the Hive Activity in an Azure data factory to run Hive queries on an on-demand/your own HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Hive activity in a Data Factory <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> executes Hive queries on <linkText>your own</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>on-demand</linkText><title></title> HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Hive activity in a Data Factory <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> executes Hive queries on <linkText>your own</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>on-demand</linkText><title></title> HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the <linkText>data transformation activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data transformation and the supported transformation activities.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the <linkText>data transformation activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data transformation and the supported transformation activities.

trans-unit.source: Text describing what the activity is used for
trans-unit.target: Text describing what the activity is used for

trans-unit.source: Input(s) consumed by the Hive activity
trans-unit.target: Input(s) consumed by the Hive activity

trans-unit.source: Output(s) produced by the Hive activity
trans-unit.target: Output(s) produced by the Hive activity

trans-unit.source: Reference to the HDInsight cluster registered as a linked service in Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Reference to the HDInsight cluster registered as a linked service in Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Store the Hive script in an Azure blob storage and provide the path to the file.
trans-unit.target: Store the Hive script in an Azure blob storage and provide the path to the file.

trans-unit.source: Specify parameters as key/value pairs for referencing within the Hive script using 'hiveconf'
trans-unit.target: Specify parameters as key/value pairs for referencing within the Hive script using 'hiveconf'

trans-unit.source: Let’s consider an example of game logs analytics where you want to identify the time spent by users playing games launched by your company.
trans-unit.target: Let’s consider an example of game logs analytics where you want to identify the time spent by users playing games launched by your company.

trans-unit.source: Below is a sample game log which is comma (,) separated and contains the following fields – ProfileID, SessionStart, Duration, SrcIPAddress, and GameType.
trans-unit.target: Below is a sample game log which is comma (,) separated and contains the following fields – ProfileID, SessionStart, Duration, SrcIPAddress, and GameType.

trans-unit.source: The Hive script to process this data looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The Hive script to process this data looks like this:

trans-unit.source: To execute this Hive script in a Data Factory pipeline, you need to the do the following
trans-unit.target: To execute this Hive script in a Data Factory pipeline, you need to the do the following

trans-unit.source: Create a linked service to register <linkText>your own HDInsight compute cluster</linkText><title></title> or configure <linkText>on-demand HDInsight compute cluster</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Create a linked service to register <linkText>your own HDInsight compute cluster</linkText><title></title> or configure <linkText>on-demand HDInsight compute cluster</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a <linkText>linked service</linkText><title></title> to configure the connection to Azure Blob storage hosting the data.
trans-unit.target: Create a <linkText>linked service</linkText><title></title> to configure the connection to Azure Blob storage hosting the data.

trans-unit.source: Create <linkText>datasets</linkText><title></title> pointing to the input and the output data.
trans-unit.target: Create <linkText>datasets</linkText><title></title> pointing to the input and the output data.

trans-unit.source: Let’s call the input dataset “HiveSampleIn” and the output dataset “HiveSampleOut”
trans-unit.target: Let’s call the input dataset “HiveSampleIn” and the output dataset “HiveSampleOut”

trans-unit.source: Copy the Hive query as a file to Azure Blob Storage configured in step #2 above.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Hive query as a file to Azure Blob Storage configured in step #2 above.

trans-unit.source: if the linked service for hosting the data is different from the one hosting this query file, create a separate Azure Storage linked service and refer to it in the activity configuration.
trans-unit.target: if the linked service for hosting the data is different from the one hosting this query file, create a separate Azure Storage linked service and refer to it in the activity configuration.

trans-unit.source: Use scriptPath **to specify the path to hive query file and **scriptLinkedService to specify the Azure storage that contains the script file.
trans-unit.target: Use scriptPath **to specify the path to hive query file and **scriptLinkedService to specify the Azure storage that contains the script file.

trans-unit.source: You can also provide the Hive script inline in the activity definition by using the script property but this is not recommended as all special characters in the script within the JSON document needs to be escaped and may cause debugging issues.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide the Hive script inline in the activity definition by using the script property but this is not recommended as all special characters in the script within the JSON document needs to be escaped and may cause debugging issues.

trans-unit.source: The best practice is to follow step #4.
trans-unit.target: The best practice is to follow step #4.

trans-unit.source: Create the below pipeline with the HDInsightHive activity to process the data.
trans-unit.target: Create the below pipeline with the HDInsightHive activity to process the data.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the pipeline using the data factory monitoring and management views.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the pipeline using the data factory monitoring and management views.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Monitoring and manage Data Factory pipelines</linkText><title></title> article for details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Monitoring and manage Data Factory pipelines</linkText><title></title> article for details.

trans-unit.source: Consider the example where the game logs are ingested daily into Azure Blob Storage and stored in a folder partitioned with date and time.
trans-unit.target: Consider the example where the game logs are ingested daily into Azure Blob Storage and stored in a folder partitioned with date and time.

trans-unit.source: You want to parameterize the Hive script and pass the input folder location dynamically during runtime and also produce the output partitioned with date and time.
trans-unit.target: You want to parameterize the Hive script and pass the input folder location dynamically during runtime and also produce the output partitioned with date and time.

trans-unit.source: To use parameterize Hive script, do the following
trans-unit.target: To use parameterize Hive script, do the following

trans-unit.source: In the Hive Script, refer to the parameter using ${hiveconf:parameterName}.
trans-unit.target: In the Hive Script, refer to the parameter using ${hiveconf:parameterName}.

trans-unit.source: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.

trans-unit.target: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via <linkText>email</linkText><title></title>.
